content:
Hi all,

I am new to Backdrop CMS and like what I see so far.

My setup is ...
Mac Retina, OS Yosemite
Mamp 5.7
Backdrop CMS
FileZilla

I have no problem installing Backdrop CMS locally.

The problem starts when I try to install it on my internet provider's shared server.
I use the same Backdrop zip file used for the local set-up.

Process ...

I first create a database and a user with full read/write access.

Then FTP across the backdrop zip file using FileZilla.
Through my cPanel, I unzip Backdrop to my root folder designated for Backdrop.

I then go to my browser and type in my domain name "xxxx.com" where the backdrop files are.
But get the following error.

"Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or misconfiguration and was unable to complete your request."

So I type in the full installation address for Backdrop

"xxxx.com/core/install.php"

Again getting the same error as above.

I am assuming it is a folder/file permission access issue
but don't know for sure.

Can you please tell me where my installation process is going wrong?

Thanks
Regards

Hi, esn. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
Hey @esn , what you see if you place to same directory instead unpacked zip just a file "index.html" with some string into?
Also, see if you can see what is in the Apache error and/or access log.

I too would start where @Vladimir suggested by testing if a .HTML file works, then a .PHP

Sometimes when adding an addon domain, Apache doesn't rebuild properly to recognize the domain. The other thing I to check is where the add-on domains folder is looking.

Question: do you plan to have or already have more than one site/domain? The primary domain on the account can cause problems if the files are in a folder inside /public_html.

Just to let you know,
I have installed drupal 9 in the same root directory and it works fine, also I've installed dolphin there too and that worked ok. Both worked on the first installation attempt.

I have just now hosed that root folder on my domain and reinstalled Drupal 9 by uploading the zip and
extracting it via cPanel.

Opened my browser and typed in the domain name and the installation screen came up straight away.
It went straight to the URL http://xxxx.com/core/install.php.

So the issue has to be with the files in Backdrop.

Regards
I'm not familiar with shared hosting/cPanel, but sounds like maybe an .htaccess issue...?

As far as I understand it, the major difference between the two types of hosting is one share's resources
with a number of users where the other has only one user.
I have deleted the .htaccess file to see if that made a difference but it didn't.
Did you check your Apache logs to see if there were any error notices there?

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt)
Thank you for your suggestion.
I was able to resolve the issue by reading that webserver log.
The solution is as follows ...

Error log stated
"SoftException in Application.cpp:267: File "/home2/xxxx/public_html/xxxx/index.php" is writeable by group"

But when I looked at the permissions of index.php the group write option was not selected.
The permission level was 644

So I selected all the permission options (The permission level was now 777) then saved the file.
Re-ran the install again (Was just checking), it still had the same error, as expected.
I then set the permission back to 644 but this time when I ran the install, it worked perfectly.

So clearly there was a problem with the webserver, for some reason
it kept reading install.php was writable by group, even though it wasn't.
So changing the permission to something else seemed to unlock its stuck state.
I probably would have only needed to set the group write option save it then un-set it to release the web-server's stuck read state.

Thank you for all contributing, it's greatly appreciated.

Regards
Glad you have worked things out in the end @esn ...please keep providing feedback and reporting any issues you may find while using Backdrop.
